bibl.title: Letter from Barratt O'Hara to Paul L. Tate, July 11, 1955 [Enclosed in 04811005]

div1.p: O'Hara asks Tate for a notarized statement that proves that Lambert participated in the yellow fever experiment with Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Barratt O'Hara to Paul L. Tate, July 11, 1955 [Enclosed in 04811005]
div1.opener:
(COPY)
CONGRESS OF THE UNITED STATES
House of Representatives
July 11, 1955
Mr. Paul L. Tate
1530 Tyler Street
Berkeley, California
Dear Mr. Tate:
div1.p:
In an effort to secure recognition for the work done
by Gustaf E. Lambert in the yellow fever experiment con-
ducted by Dr. Walter Reed during the Spanish American War,
I have introduced H.R. 5590. In returning an unfavorable
report the Secretary of the Army stated:

“Nothing has been found to show that Lambert offered
himself for experimentation or participated in the
yellow fever experiment in Cuba, 1900-1901 ......”

It is my understanding that you are in a position to
refute this allegation. It would help materially, I am sure,
if you could seannd a notarized statement of the facts as you
know them to:

Major Vernon McKenzie
Office of the Surgeon General
United States Army
Rm. 2734, Navy Building
18th & Constitution Ave., N.W.
Washington 25, D. C.
div1.closer:
Thank you for cooperation in this effort,
Cordially and sincerely (signed)
Barratt O'Hara, M. C.
BOH/csg
----------------------------------------
Original sent to Major McKenzie with my notarized statement
and additional remarks, copies of which are enclosed with
this. Am very glad to help in this matter to the best of
my ability, and I certainly wish you success.
Cordially & sincerely yours,
Paul L. Tate
